intro: Asyneuma canescens subsp. salicifolium, commonly known as the silky sandmat, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are usually silky-hairy, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months.
